A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
One viewing is probably not enough to fully appreciate this film. It seemed to rattle past like a  train. Also very choppy\, cutting between three threads (roughly aligned with Poe\, Finn\, Rey). It might have benefited from staying with one story thread for a longer time\, instead of constantly switching between them.

There were a couple of moments that seemed to be there to explain a plot point clumsily\, telling instead of showing\, but they were rare.

But none of these little gripes take away from the essential facts: the journey taken by Rey\, Luke and Kylo is ultimately brilliantly told\, incredible performances and full of surprises.

The stories around Poe and Finn were a lot shallower\, but still entertaining.

I felt that much of the film was about deliberately letting the audience experience a slowly building frustration as our heroes struggle to get anywhere\, making the moments of triumphant progress that much more meaningful.

A very different style to The Force Awakens\, and much less of a conscious homage to the "feel" of Star Wars. There was speculation that The Last Jedi would literally mimic The Empire Strikes Back too closely. Well\, in one sense it has: a lot of fans hated TESB on its original release and it took years to be accepted for what it is: as a major step forward\, a risk-taking experiment that had to happen\, a deeper\, richer take on characters.
